content: Very good experience with all the features and navigations. the only thing needs to be improved is filters. the all does not allow to select multiple filters at one time. the moment user selects one filter, the filter closes and search starts. because of which user has to go to filters multiple times to add multiple filters. A suggestion to improve filters.

more clutter and slower than the previous app, which they did not care to uninstall when forcing the move to this version. general shopping continues to get worse - scrolling through hundreds of similar items you can't filter out, only to have the app freeze before you get to something interesting. either improve the filtering or go back to being able to skip entire pages of results. I shop more on Ebay now as a result.

New user interface is appalling, there are article type things for recommended products that you have to scroll past, you have to choose and apply filters one at a time, you have to go through pages.. the once super easy, streamline app is now a hassle to use for shopping or even browsing products. They seem more focused on putting everything in your face other than what you're really shopping for.This app has really gone downhill with the last couple updates. Change it back, make it good again.

Always trying to make money to the point of I wanted instrument clusters. I put the filter of 50-100$. What's it do give me 90 plus light bulbs all under $20 saying featured. So I change it to high to low on pricing. First off it dropped half the items instead of reorganizing them(tried it a few times, I wasnt messing up). And ONLY kept the featured items. F*** Bezos

I've used this app almost daily for ages, but the latest update is terrible. Having to click through pages every 10 or 20 search results rather than a continuous scroll is terrible design, and the filters/sorting switched from a popup menu to (again) clicking through pages. It's like they took the app design back to 1990's desktop tech. If you haven't updated your app yet, DON'T.

the new update is TERRIBLE. Why have you changed the filter layout? Before the update the filter section stayed on the same page. Now when you click the filter option, it takes you to a seperate screen, away from your search. The new feature has also slowed down my app. It takes a few seconds for the new filter screen to appear. Sometimes the filters dont appear at all, and i have to restart the app a few time. Go BACK to the original design/layout!

Kinda like CostCo or IKEA, but without the fun: impossible to shop without wasting a lot of time, & you'll probably spend more money than you'd intended. It's also the Facebook of shopping: overly "sticky", bloated with opportunities to "engage", truly awful UI. Only useful if you have a very specific need & know the exact part number or equiv., hence the second star.

Latest update changed the filters to be less helpful, instead of just scrolling through and selecting what I need; if I enter a section on the filter I now have to select back to get out, but it completely takes you out of the filters so you have to keep going back in to the filters. Also now there are pages... Instead of just scrolling and scrolling now we have to select next page and wait for it to load, too much. What a pain in the butt for a mobile app. Amazon change it back please.

I loved shopping on Amazon until the most recent update. 1) The app is ridiculously slow. 2) Searching is a nightmare. 3) Filtering a search is even more of a nightmare because you can't select multiple options. 4) The drag & drop feature for adding items to a list has disappeared. Aren't apps supposed to be more convenient than websites? Not in this case. The Amazon app is the website's mini me, and that's not a good thing. Come on guys. You were doing so well!

3 steps back. Loss continuous scrolling, now opens a new screen for filters, after selecting anything it immediately searches which annoying when you are trying add several items to filter, . and a overall dated interface. It is so bad removed the app. As it works exactly the same in a browser. Please go back the previous version much better when searching.

it's a good app, but there are a couple glaring design flaws. For example, if example I'm searching by album I only need to see each album one time. I understand that your trying to engineer addiction by copying slot machine mechanics, but in this context all you've accomplished is reduced functionality. Also, if a song title runs too long and is cut off by an ellipses, if I turn my phone sideways it should display the extended title instead of blowing up the size of the album.

The app is slow. I've been a prime member for half a year or so and I order stuff fairly often. eBay, Lowe's and home Depot all work just fine, full speed and no issues, so I don't think it's my phone. whenever I'm looking at a product with different color options or bundles etc, it almost freezes, that's how slow it is. it's really frustrating. definitely not user friendly.

Of all the things I love with Amazon, this app lets them all down. Searching is clunky and awkward to use.. and forget it by department. Then there are too many ads getting in the way, sponsored or otherwise. If I search for Bose, I don't want ads for others I'm never going to buy spoiling the search results. The web page in a browser is easier by far. Amazon dump this app as it's useless!

App is laggy and basically stops working if used for an extended period of time. For example, after browsing for a while, if I tap on an item to see details, the screen goes black. Sometimes it just starts glitching. I try scrolling, but nothing happens. Sometimes I can go to the previous page and tap on the item again to see the details, but most of the time I have to restart the app. It's a pain in the ass to have to redo your search with filters over and over again when this happens.

Has pretty much everything I'm looking for, although, sometimes it gets confused or turns up no results, prompting it to suggest something completely different. If I have an issue, there is a part of the app where you can contact someone for help, but the bad part is, when I asked the question, I didnt get a real response (which only partially helped and gave a refferal and a link to try and fix my problem, which never really got resolved) and didn't get any sort of response for ~3mo...

The features in this recent Android update are terrible. One of the best things about shopping on the Amazon App was continuous scrolling. I can't stand using the next button. The filters are not good either. I wish there was a way to set default search parameters for your account. For instance it would be nice not to have to click the prime button every time.

A step down from the Underground version. The filter options are not as uniform nor are the results always what you searched. And then 20 results are all you get until you go to the next page. It's odd, I thought for sure that the app that we are all being forced to use now would have a more user friendly interface like the one that was recently discontinued. Maybe it's a way to keep us on the same version, I get that, but maybe update it with better features?

When the app works, it's great. However, the vast majority of the time, whenever I try to search for something on the app it will initially load the page, but seconds later will load the picture of a dog with the words, "uh-oh, looks like something went wrong." I have this experience both on WiFi and 4G connections. I would recommend just using their website instead. Don't waste your time trying to get the app to work.

Terrible "upgrade" The latest version makes me want to go shop in a brick and mortar store. I can't easily add products to lists, the filters are inefficient, using a filter makes it HARDER to find an item, and the limited number of items per page wastes so much time. I wish there was a way to uninstall the latest version. I miss my daily dose of Amazon instant gratification.

Dearest Amazon, READ YOUR LATEST REVIEWS! It's frustrating to have to click to view more on the search results instead of just scrolling through an endless list. Even more frustrating is the irrelevant items that appear in search results. I miss the drag and drop to the floating wishlist and had hoped to see it return with the last update. Instead, you chose to make the app less user friendly. Please fix!

Garbage update. What is this "from" bullfeces! Oh this item starts at $8.99 but when you look at all the sizes and color options, $8.99 doesn't exist! All the items you are able to see start at $16.99. BAIT AND SWITCH PRICING! IT'S VERY TIME CONSUMING LOOKING AT ITEMS AND WAITING FOR ALL THE PRICING, SIZING, COLOR INFO TO LOAD ONLY TO NOT FIND THE PRICE SHOWN IN THE SEARCH LIST! Removed scrolling and replaced with next button eliminating knowing how many items are left.

I use Amazon a lot, and app was great. Until this version where results are now in pages and you see lot more sponsored items appearing per page. This makes finding what you want much harder, so much that I'm actually writing about it. Also filters can be better (but that's the same on the website too) Realtime tracking is helpful (introduced a few versions back) having an app feedback would have spared this 1 star review. Bring the pageless scrolling back and I'll make this app a general!

I have an Amazon warehouse nearby and can see exactly where the Amazon truck carrying my package is at the moment and how many stops it has left until it gets to me. Not applicable to everybody, but the app handles this feature really well. Also, in my experience, the app is actually a bit easier to navigate in some ways than the website. At least, the basic design is more intuitive. Also, as a general rating for the Amazon service, I'd also give 5 stars. It's easy to shop confidently.

The recent update is awful in my opinion. The filter options take up the entire screen and only allow you to choose one filter at a time. The search results make you flip through several pages instead of scrolling through just one, making it difficult to get back to an item you considered a "maybe" item. It's very disappointing and I don't even want to use it anymore which is sad, although my husband will be happy I'm not shopping anymore.

Old UI was much better and friendlier. Could set all filters in one shot. Now it's only possible to do one at a time, even where multiple choices are possible (which isn't clear because they're radio buttons too; something covered in UI Design 099!) Furthermore, sorting results don't come out the way one sets them. It's embarrassing!

The new filter screen is worthless and spoils the user experience. I have to press back key couple of time during navigation between search result and filter screen. Moreover now a days many mobile don't have navigation keys, user experience on such mobile has become cumbersome. Unless old filter menu comes back I am not buying anything on Amazon.

really disappointed with the last update - searching and filtering is now much more cumbersome. Every time you select a filter it takes you back to the results whereas you used to be able to select multiple filters at once then apply them all. Also now you can only select one filter option for some categories - for example instead of searching for shoes with two ranges of heel heights you can only select one at a time. This is going backwards - not an improvement.

Worst Update Ever I love Amazon, but like so many other people have said, this most recent update has been terrible. I don't like to complain--I'm a positive person--but it takes forever to set up filters on searches. I love the diversity of items available, but when I'm searching for something in particular, that variety is disastrous, since it takes forever to narrow 20,000 items to something manageable and pertinent to what I'm looking for. The next button is frustrating. And it's so slow!

This app is so glitchy. It freezes for no reason when trying to add things to the cart. It won't auto log me into my account and I have to log in before every purchase and deal with the annoying "get free 2 day shipping" ads when I already have prime. I don't see a point to having this app when Amazon already makes it super easy to shop in your mobile browser.

In general, UI loads and functions like a bulky app from early 2015. The wishlists UI loads and functions like a MySpace back in the day, you can't multi-select, you can't drag n drop, you can't customize or sort how u view the items within the lists. Overall,very lazy app, focused more on advertising, and trying to make u buy more than you need, rather than helping you find what you wanted to buy in the first place. Facebook, which has much more media content, Loads 100% Faster than this app

Aug 6 App Update HORRIBLE!!!! I buy from Amazon multiple times a month and spend a lot of $ there but the ease of the app is gone. I might stop using it until this is fixed! The FILTER no longer has specific options. i searched for curtains n I didn't even get to choose if i wanted solid color or pattern so i had to weed through literally thousands I didn't want to find what I wanted. Now im ordering from WAYFAIR instead!! & the results only show like 15 at a time so I have to keep hitting next

UI feels clunky and very slow. Constantly tapping wrong things due to slowness in loading. Search and filter options are sub par. When searching for a specific item, my results are generally filled with unrelated products and advertising. Always have better search results when using Google Search via web browser which helps expose better pricing options outside of Amazon.

This app has gone back and forth with having endless scrolling and being able to hold and drag an item into a wishlist. Then no matter the device I have it seems to crash constantly. And when adding to a Wishlist was drag and drop before it would crash it would change the list you were adding things in to a completely different list without warning. Very buggy and lagging. Im hoping that the app is the way it is now because they're fixing these problems that should have been resolved ages ago...

New updated App, great. Using my Galaxy S8+ I don't see a 'Log out' option?? It's not on the drop down options when you click the top left screen once logged in to your account. Or is that the point? That you stay logged in the whole time? The App is not intuitive to use if one cannot easily find the log out button, is it?! A helpful suggestion would be to improve that.

Missing key Amazon Prime features! I thought the Amazon App would be great since I shop there a lot. But I soon realized, that with the Amazon app you cannot donate to a charity the way you can on the website! Also if you ever do Prime Pantry where are the essentials are cheaper, this cannot be done from the app. Amazon seems unable or unwilling to fix either problem. The search engine is also terrible! I have literally put in exactly the name of what Amazon calls a product and not find it!

Overall I was happy with this app but lately it has been crashing at least once a week. Nice picture of a cute dog to tell me something went wrong but the cuteness fades when it is always crashing. The only fix is to reboot my phone or remove and reinstall. This time I removed the app permanently and just added a bookmark to login from the website. I would have thought Amazon would have fixed this bug buy now. I've searched for a reason only to find many people have the same problem and no fix.

Never reviewed this app til now. I really dont like the new way the app is played out. I loved the tap and drag to list function, and the continuous scrolling when browsing. Get rid of the next and previous buttons, bring back continuous scrolling, and also bring back the tap and drag to lists function and rating will improve drastically. Would have given a 5* but now you only get 1*

I love the app as I can shop and search for things on the go. however there was a feature that I loved and got used to using that they seemed to have taken away? whenever I was shopping, I used to be able to click on the image and drag it to the list at the bottom. if I needed to change the list i could... it's been about a month now that I cannot use that feature. I mean...#FirstWorldProblems but it was easier to shop that way. otherwise it'd of gotten 5 stars.

It's a solid app running a version of Chrome browser. Permissions are reasonable and can be switched on and off without effecting functionality. The only thing is like all 3rd party apps you are granting certain privacy rights that you don't need to when browsing with a good browser. That being said, it's Amazon they already have all your information anyway so the app is quicker and easy to use. I personally prefer using the app because it's lightweight and is quick.

Eliminate last android update for Galaxy Note 9. No continuous scrolling. Filter selection sends right back to product list so you are unable to select multiple options to filter. Filter menu is no longer a window: now is a new page. Also, for the last few months prior to the last upgrade, the tray is gone, which was very useful. Please fix asap as I use the app daily. These changes are a deterrent.

I use Amazon for pretty much everything. Since the most recent update, hitting Buy Now once charges me twice and sends two items. I've tried to only purchase items by going to my cart and checking out that way, but every now and then it will slip my mind and I'll end up with two items and have to go out of my way to return one. I would really like this issue resolved.

Wow.. Since this last upgrade, entirely disappointed.. Why bring back the completely detestable "next" button? Plus, your filters are so limited. I want to choose a color on any category and I am being given two, yes, TWO color options at a time. I was looking at curtains and want purple for a kids room, my filter options? Black or gold!! No other color was offered in the filter. Was looking at comforters, filter options were grey or yellow!! I wanted red!! Return our options, no NEXT button!

As a Prime Member who orders quite often, it shouldn't be this difficult now to do the following: Sort without losing 1000s of results. Sort within the category. Why do you have to keep going back and forth to filter the subcategory? Navigate. There should be an option to see all results on one page instead of this never ending next button. This new experience is very time consuming. These issues are very important for variety shoppers and needs to be addressed as soon as possible.

Why do companies insist on changing things that work perfectly well? The most recent update has changed the filtering system. Instead of something that overlays the main body of the app like before, clicking on "filter" now opens its own new page, and it will shove you back to the product list on each filter change. It is also slower to load than before. It was a much more fluid experience before.

Get ready for spam calls!! I just signed up for Prime and was told I can get a $10 credit if I download the app. No credit was given. It just keeps telling me to complete Step 2 which is sign into the app even though I've completed that step numerous times now. AND the app said it needed access to literally everything on my phone. The very next day I start receiving tons of spam phone calls that I never got before. Kind of a coincidence?? I'm pretty sure they sold my phone number.

when on wifi(tested with multiple different networks)app will load any page properly at first, then switch over to the stupid dog errors that don't give any useful information. It is obvious it's able to load all the information, as the pages have all of the information before the error pops up. issue has been happening for years and has never been fixed.

I love shopping through Amazon but I get the "something's gone wrong" notification (with adorable dog picture) very often. It's frustrating when you're trying to buy things and you have to start everything all over each time period I was just trying to buy something for half an hour and I was not successful I had to restart 5 times. Other than that it seems to be a good app. But if it doesn't work and doesn't let me buy things isn't it shooting itself in the foot?

PSA Galaxy S10 users!!! Do not update !!! If your app suddenly sucks , its due to the update. Go into application and uninstall the updates . Its working like it used to since I did this! Got my click and drag to wish list back and no more clicking arrow for next page when searching for items. Amazon , why the hell would you put out an update THAT MADE YOUR APPLICATION WORSE!!!??

Useless if you are not in the USA, wasted hours for nothing. I put in an Australian address, it wrote a line in the description of some items "eligible for shipping to Australia". First problem, no filter, so you have to wade through listings to see which say that. Made sure I only looked at items eligible. Then went to the check-out and, lo and behold, got error messages on all the items I had carefully selected saying "Amazon can't shop this to Australia". Profoundly disappointed, huge waste.

Not a fan of the new update, specifically the changes made for the filter options. Before, the filters would just pop-up on top of the results and I can change the filters and the results would refresh quickly in the background. In this new update, the filter process is less smooth and more time consuming because it almost takes me to another page separate from the results. After each filter, it takes me to the new results so i have to redo the whole process for each filter I add.

The sorting price by Low to High feature isn't good. You have really allow Amazon NOT to do the searches if you're looking for low low prices, do a search multiple times, and scroll for best results. Adapters, and plastic electronics like such, should be 1 cent plus shipping but sometimes it's hard to see/find the low bargains.

Latest update has ruined it. Gone is the shopping list tray where you can drag items (which I used all the time) and absolutely hate having results paged. Why couldn't they just leave the app alone! As someone who is physically unable to visit shops and carry items home, I rely on home delivery for everything and always loved the app, until now.

For the past several weeks, the app has been non functioning. I have restarted my device multiple times. I have uninstalled and reinstalled. It does not matter what I do. Every time I use the app, I get a picture of a dog and a error message. It's been happening daily for weeks. I might get an occasional minute where the app works, but that's it. I had zero complaints until this started happening. can we fix this?????

They busted the app with latest update. Wish list tray is gone. Do a search on anything. Popcorn. 20k results. Filter low to high, 41 results.... Update: Somehow the wish list has fixed itself on my phone but still does not work on my girlfriends iphone. Update2: Filtering has been improved and wish list appears to work on iPad and but not her iphone. Updated stars but will stop using app. Smile amazon com should just be an option in the app, no technical reason for it not to be. Use browser now

WISH LIST (banner at the bottom) stopped showing after the last update (Ver. 18). Can't drag-n-drop items into lists like before. Downgrading back to ver. 16, kind of brought the list(s) back. Also, the search results from the app are much more limited than searching the amazon site via google. Lately been doing all searching on google and putting things in my cart, just so I can see them in the Amazon App. Am using Samsung Galaxy S9/Verizon running Android 9 (Pie).

I really like the app. However, I am NOT a fan of the recent update to the Filter options and the addition of the next button. The previous Filter was just fine, you could select multiple filters without having to go back in to select each one. And the continuous scrolling was great! Who wants to press next 20 times!

They have many items to offer, but their Prime membership delivery sucks. Multiple times they don't deliver the day they are "guaranteed " to deliver the items. Then they let you know 2 hours before the time they are suppose to. Their customer service is not in this country, USA, and they can't speak for themselves, just a script. If an answer is not on their script they just ignore you and repeat the same information over and over again, like 4 or 5 times. They are getting bad!!!

I have had to uninstall and install the app multiple times. every time i go to search a puppy comes up and tell me that something went wrong on their end and i have to return to amazon home. i cant search anything on the app. i have to pull it up in chrome on a web page instead of the app to do any kind of shopping. its getting really annoying not veing able to use the app

Functionally the latest update is problematic. I have issues with the using filters, I hate that so few items appear per page, and that i now how to press these big Next/Previous buttons. The search engine is bizarre in that some of the results are just so badly wrong, it'd be hilarious if it didn't grow old very quickly and impede the search function. I have to say it had always been this way, it's not confined to the latest update. Finally, the app just does stops working as it has hung.

I find the app aesthetically not appealing, its often slightly buggy with transitions. it's not as quick as it could be against its biggest rival ebay. Lots of blank area not utilised it often misses features you can find on the desktop site and its been this way for years now. They haven't updated the app in any significant way for what must be over 3 years. its functional which is why it gets a two star.

Love using Amazon in general however, the phone app features makes going on Amazon tedious at times. When I use the "low to high" filter, most of the items aren't shown anymore. And the new update deleted the wish list drag and drop tray. I don't know why they deleted that feature because it made scrolling through items easier and efficient. You were able to look at the things that caught your eye closer because you dragged them down to the wish list tray. Love Amazon, don't love those issues.

i have prime but it is not working. the item i am trying to buy is eligable for prime, but i still have to pay extra for shipping. it sucks because i am getting cheated out of my money. i have to pay more for shipping than for prime. Also, it doesnt tell you shipping. it only says, "Free shipping on orders above $25" THATS NOT WHAT I AM LOOKING FOR!!! i often have to buy an item and cant even see the price before that! this sucks. i cant use amazon cause i dont want to accidentally spend money.

I keep installing and uninstalling this app. It has some benefits over the website - it is easy to navigate - but it doesn't have a "find on this page" function. I often want to search for some feature and I have to scroll up and down the page to look for it. I uninstall it so Google results take me to the Amazon webpage where I can search the page for the feature or spec I'm interested in.

I find the Amazon shopping app great, with excellent deals on all items. I collect cards as a hobby,and the prices for them are unbeatable as opposed to other shopping sites with the exact same cards I want. It's a great alternative to eBay and many other shopping apps that gouge in taxes/fees. I love the app,and as a first time buyer,I recommend it highly to those who want products at a guaranteed fair price without the hassle.

I was placing an order and seen that a $25 or over gets free shipping, as it popped up. I was picking items and noticed some did and some did not qualify for or add to the $25...to get free shipping. Then I reseleted items to get free shipping. And I went to check out and was being charged for shipping...unless I clicked the "sign for free Amizon Prime" stuff. I almost cancelled when I figured out the secret way to select free shipping...guided advertising and my last order!

Thlatest update where the filter settings wer changed is horrible. We used to be able to filter and see how the list of products changed as we filtered so we could keep choosing different filters until we got what we were looking for. Now the filter options are full screen and we have to go back and forth. Awful!

Bring back list tray! It's very frustrating to have to click each item, click the heart, and then back track to do it all over again. Also I loved the long list of items instead of having to click the next button. Please fix this. I had to go back to the factory settings just to have the app enjoyable again.

this app is horrible. it repeatedly sends things to my moms house across town instead of my address, no matter how many times i correct it. the "one click buy" keeps ordering things to the wrong address, with expired cards, when i didnt even mean to press it. this app, aswell as every other amazon made app i have ever used, are absolutely terrible. they never work right.

Amazon is awful. A horrible company with horrible people. Be careful because they'll lock your account for moving to a new state, but dont worry! They keep your Amazon Prime charges going with no way to unsubscribe from them. They say it's to "prevent fraudulent behavior" or something like that yet they charge. Trying to contact people who care is another horror story. I have been trying to unsubscribe from Amazon Prime for over two months and nothing. Just pain and an overdrawn bank account.

I started buying from amazon because I wanted books which aren't easily found where I live. And I could find whatever I wanted in amazaon even if is it is not that known. I bought two times. The first time, it went well and they didn't charge me except with what was told. The next time, the books took a long time to arrive, and when they did, they had put another large value saying it was because of other taxes (they never told me about it when I was paying). It was something I wanted to know.

Most annoying thing when I'm trying to click a picture to view the product closer and the picture won't open. Sometimes clicking it doesn't respond to anything and sometimes the pictures just loads and loads and never actually opens. This has been a problem for awhile, why has this not been fixed.

Awful update, app was easily 5 stars before. Since the August 2019 update whenever you search it only provides a few items before having to press Next and wait for more to load. Also the facility to long press on an item & drag to your wish list at the bottom of the screen has vanished. I often add items to compare later to my wishlist so this function is sadly missed. Please developers take note & restore the app to before the 'update'. This app has lost it's appeal now making browsing stilted.

There has been a bug for awhile that when you select options for a product, the "done" button doesn't work and you can't select any options. You have to go back in order to get the menu to shut. Also if I'm using my vpn while I'm on public wifi the whole app doesn't work.

Bring back the old filtering method! The new way of selecting and applying filters is horrible. If you want to drill down into more specific categories, you need to keep going back to the filter page (which itself is a slight improvement of the previous implementation). But the need to keep going back to the page is very annoying.

Edit - Still no fix. Sorted by "Featured" 40,000 results, Sorted by "Low to High" 74 results. Ridiculous! So tired of the app! The screen goes black, shuts down, reverts me back to the main screen for no reason and the search settings are horrendous! I search for an item, see over 1000 items, then select sort from low to high and all of a sudden there are only 200 items or less to view! This app needs work and I cant even find where to submit bug reports without chatting with customer support.

my first bad experience with Amazon. I order a part for my work truck was a two day shipping and my order was shipped late and is coming a day later. I had a few other options for cheaper costing parts that would of came at the same time frame not very happy. customer service was no help. If it happens again it will be the last time I order thru Amazon

App does not work anymore. the app used to work but now everytime I try to use the app it says "UH-OH Something went wrong on our end" it's been happening for the past few weeks and I cant do anything about it. I constantly check the app and maybe once every 5 days it works for a bit but goes back to not working. I own a Samsung Galaxy s8 and I don't know the problem I have tried deleting and reinstalling but after that it wouldn't let me back into my account until the app actually works.

amazon sent me a link while browsing online with a $10 credit offer to download and log into their app. I did so and and assembled a 25 dollar order. I was disappointed the offer didn't apply automatically so I searched online. the site says the promotion has ended. huh. guess I was twenty minutes too late. didn't want to download the app but gave it the shot based on a false marketing promise. maybe it's good for some users, but I'mma go ahead and uninstall.

This app has become more difficult for users. Biggest change is the lists. You used to be able to simply drag items to the list tab on the bottom of screen. Now they have completely removed the list tab and require you to go through several steps to add it to an off-screen list. Very user-unfriendly

App doesnt show camera icon to take picture of tape bar code to get the $5 discount. crashes a lot of the time and freezes. Way too many adds that you cant close they will open when you click on the X and take you to another website so you lose your search. With the $ amazon rakes in they have no business outting ads on the very place people are buying from

Good app very easy to use would definitely reccomend to download for easy access to Amazon only downside is for me I'm experiencing problems with add to cart and buy now sometimes it feels like I have to press the button hundreds on times for it to work like the app has a problem loading that page? Apart from that yes I give this app a 7/10 very easy to use just like the website and easy to access from the home screen.

NO MORE CONTINUOUS SCROLLING?? I use the Amazon app on the daily & with the new update I have to use a "next" button to go thru pages? And the filtering is clunky now.
